title: What is Subconsciousness and How Does it Affect Our Mental Processes?
first_phrase: In this final section, the author discusses the concept of sub-consciousness and its different types of reactions to internal and external stimuli. They explain that mental associations, spontaneous appearance of images or memories, and dream processes are all part of this sub-conscious category. The author also examines the sub-consciousness caused by detachment or reduction in conscious attention or translation ability, as well as how these forms of detachment can produce sleepwalking, induced by special disciplines, hypnosis, or anesthetics. Finally, the author touches on sub-conscious memory and how everything that passes through consciousness leaves an indelible trace. This section concludes the discussion on sub-consciousness by emphasizing the vastness of its reach and the potential for it to manifest in different ways.

Parlando delta subcoscienza, bisogna far cenno alla memoria subcosciente (criptomnesia). Non vi è nulla che passi nella coscienza (nel senso piú largo in cui abbiamo inteso questo termine) e che non lasci una traccia inde- lebile. Di rigore, solo i processi di tipo 1 e 2 possono dirsi coscienti e fanno parte della memoria comune. Ma questa è una piccola sezione di un magazzino infinita- mente piú vasto, il quale conserva anche gli elementi giunti attraverso tutti gli altri processi che abbiamo indi- cato e che cadono sotto la soglia della coscienza esterna, ovvero tra le connessure e le interruzioni di quest'ulti- ma. In circostanze adatte questo materiale infracosciente e subcosciente può emergere e manifestarsi, indiretta- mente (scrittura automatica, visione nel cristallo, ecc.) od anche direttamente.
last_phrase: In conclusion, our subliminal and subconscious processes are vast and intricate, regulating our memory and association in ways we may not fully comprehend or be aware of. However, with the right setting, this material can surface and provide us with insights that can help solve seemingly inexplicable phenomena. It is vital to understand that there is no clear line between conscious and subconscious processes, but rather a vast and complex network of mental processes, which operate often in the shadows of our awareness.
